result.execSummary:
The defendant Camron J. Lane was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: all other sentences currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week;
Maintain absolute sobriety and no possession of alcohol or controlled substance, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed;

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; 

AODA and follow up;

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: all other sentences currently serving

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Camron J. Lane

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

3:48p.m.
Clerk Micki.

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for ADA Kerri Puig; Defendant appears in person in custody from the MCJ, pro se.

Date and time set for a JPTC. 

COURT addresses defendant regarding SPD counsel.
Defendant wishes to move forward without an attorney. 
ADA Mayo makes statement. 
COURT makes statement.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to: 
COUNT 2: Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
COUNT 1: Possess w/Intent Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc. (>10-50g), Second Subsequent Offense, Repeater >> GUILTY.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, defendant is competent to represent self, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 10 years WPS (4 years IC; 6 years ES), to run concurrent to all other sentences currently serving; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and f/u; Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week; Maintain absolute sobriety and no possession of alcohol or controlled substance, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed; DNA surcharge; Eligible for programming; and CC. 42 days jail credit. 

Adj: 4:01 p.m.
Deft's notice of JPTC on 9/14/22 - 'return to sender; not deliverable as addressed; unable to forward'
re Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Pros re the 09.14.22 Judicial Pretrial Conference
Deft's notice of preliminary hearing on 8/22/2022 - 'return to sender; not deliverable as addressed; unable to forward'
Judicial Pretrial - in court on September 14, 2022 at 02:50 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on August 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:59 AM 
Clerk Micki.

State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen for ADA Kerri Puig.  Defendant fails to appear.

Date and time preliminary hearing. 

ADA Coonen makes statement - Defendant in custody at the Oneida County Jail.
COURT makes statement.
ADA Coonen makes statement regarding bond.  Is not requesting to be forfeited.

COURT finds good cause to extend time limits until the RH on 8/5/22 at 1:00 p.m.

RH - 8/5/22 at 1:00 p.m. (Br. 3)

ADJ: 12:03 a.m.

Clerk: Becca. 
Case Called: 1:28 pm. 

Deft appears via video, in custody, pro se.  
Date and time set for review re: public defender representation prior to preliminary hearing. 
Court notes deft. has not made contact with SPD for evaluation.
Prelim set for 08/01/2022 to remain on calendar - deft. wishes to proceed pro se. 

Adj: 1:30 pm.
Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 3:15 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty John Mathie. 
Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved. 

COURT ORDERS: $1000 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 

BRANCH 3 CASE.  
RH: 7/27/2022 at 1pm in Courtroom B.  
Prelim: 8/1/2022 at 11:30 am in Courtroom B.
